title: The ‘Bear Market Signal’: This Bitcoin Indicator Just Flashed Red After 3 Years
body: Bitcoin stabilized above $66,000 on Friday, though the asset has fallen about 30% over the past month. According to analysis by Alphractal, Bitcoin’s Realized Cap Impulse (Long-Term) has turned negative for the first time in three years. When this signal turned negative in past cycles, the crypto asset entered extended downturns as long-term capital inflows weakened. Bitcoin’s Capital Structure Bitcoin’s long-term Realized Cap Impulse tracks changes in realized capitalization over extended periods and is used to assess whether new capital is entering the network or whether inflows are slowing or reversing. A negative reading indicates that new capital inflows have weakened or stalled, demand is no longer absorbing supply at the same pace, and the network’s structural growth has moved into a contraction phase. Alphractal explained that in previous market cycles, every instance in which the Realized Cap Impulse (Long-Term) turned negative was followed by significant price corrections or prolonged bear markets. The firm linked this pattern to Bitcoin’s supply-demand dynamics and said that when supply remains available while new capital inflows decline, downward pressure on price typically emerges. Unlike traditional market capitalization, realized capitalization values BTC at the price it last moved on-chain, which allows the metric to reflect actual capital committed to the network rather than price-driven fluctuations. By filtering out short-term market noise, the indicator focuses on long-term capital behavior over months and years. With the signal now negative again after three years, Alphractal said the current cycle is potentially entering a phase of structural weakening in capital inflows. Meanwhile, Alphractal founder Joao Wedson also said that “even with ETFs accumulating and large institutions like Strategy increasing their positions, it is still not enough to offset the period when supply exceeds demand.” Global Uncertainty The latest on-chain capital trends appear to be unfolding against a macro backdrop of unusually high uncertainty. As per CryptoQuant, the Global Uncertainty Index has reached an all-time high, after exceeding levels seen during the 9/11 attacks, the Iraq War, the 2008 financial crisis, the Eurozone debt crisis, as well as the Covid-19 pandemic. CryptoQuant stated that the current reading demonstrates an environment where markets are struggling to find direction, capital is moving with greater caution, and risk is being priced more aggressively. The data also indicates that geopolitical, economic, and political pressures are all active at the same time. This environment has created conditions in which high volatility may become a feature rather than a temporary disruption. Periods of extreme uncertainty have coincided with significant changes in market positioning, as participants reassess exposure amid unstable conditions. While uncertainty often triggers defensive behavior, the firm added that such phases have also seen periods of large-scale repositioning. The post The ‘Bear Market Signal’: This Bitcoin Indicator Just Flashed Red After 3 Years appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Israel Indicts Two Over Polymarket Iran Bets
body: Prosecutors are pursuing charges including security offenses, bribery, and obstruction of justice. Separately, in the United States, Connecticut resident Elmin Redzepagic has been charged in a 21-count federal indictment alleging he defrauded investors of nearly $1 million in a cryptocurrency scheme, lost the funds on the offshore gambling platform Stake.com, and committed wire fraud, international money laundering, and false statements to IRS agents. Israel Moves Against Insider Wagers Israeli authorities have arrested and indicted two individuals for allegedly using classified information to place bets on the prediction market platform Polymarket concerning potential Israeli military action against Iran. In a joint statement that was released Thursday, Israel’s Defense Ministry, the Shin Bet internal security service, and police said the case involves a military reservist and a civilian who were detained after an investigation. According to authorities, the reservist — who was working for Shin Bet — obtained secret military information and used it to inform bets placed on Polymarket. Prosecutors intend to pursue criminal charges that include security-related offenses, bribery, and obstruction of justice. Announcement from the Ministry of Defence The case attracted a lot of attention because prediction markets allow users to wager on real-world events, including geopolitical developments and military actions. Israeli officials warned that using insider knowledge in such markets creates a “real security risk” to Israel Defense Forces operations and broader national security activity. The Defense Ministry added that military, security, and police units will continue taking action against anyone who unlawfully uses classified information. The Israeli state-owned news outlet Kan previously reported that a Polymarket account under the name “ricosuave666” placed multiple bets related to Israel’s military operations in Iran in June of 2025. The account reportedly wagered tens of thousands of dollars and earned more than $152,300 in profits, including over $128,700 from a market predicting Israeli military action against Iran by a specified date. It is still unclear whether the two individuals arrested are connected to that account. The case follows concerns about insider trading risks in prediction markets. Earlier this year, controversy emerged after a Polymarket user profited approximately $400,000 from a bet predicting that Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro would be ousted shortly before he was captured by US forces. A lawyer representing the reservist argued that the indictment is flawed and stated that a charge related to harming national security has been dropped, though other charges are still in place. The case is expected to proceed through the Israeli court system. Connecticut Man Charged in Crypto Fraud Meanwhile, a Connecticut man has been charged in a sweeping federal indictment alleging he defrauded investors out of almost $1 million in a cryptocurrency scheme that prosecutors say unraveled into gambling losses and international money transfers. The US Department of Justice announced Thursday that Elmin Redzepagic of Connecticut faces a 21-count indictment tied to alleged crypto-related fraud. According to prosecutors, Redzepagic presented himself as a seasoned cryptocurrency investor capable of delivering high returns, and persuaded people to entrust him with their funds between May of 2021 and March of 2025. Press release from the US Attorney’s Office Authorities allege that instead of investing the money as promised, Redzepagic lost close to $1 million belonging to others on the offshore gambling platform Stake.com. Prosecutors say he reassured investors about the status of their supposed profits and encouraged them to commit more funds, following what officials described as a familiar pattern of deception that is very often seen in investment fraud schemes. The indictment includes three counts of making false statements to IRS Criminal Investigation agents, seven counts of wire fraud, and 11 counts of international money laundering. Each count of making a false statement carries a maximum penalty of five years in prison, while the wire fraud and international money laundering charges each carry potential sentences of up to 20 years per count if convicted. Federal authorities allege that Redzepagic misrepresented the nature and performance of the investments by claiming to generate impressive returns while fabricating explanations to maintain investor confidence. Among the alleged tactics were false claims that additional “gas fees” were required to unlock or withdraw profits that did not exist. Prosecutors contend that these statements were used to delay withdrawals and secure further payments from victims. The Justice Department also said Redzepagic claimed to operate as part of a team that included an individual referred to as “The Chef,” whom he described as a ringleader. It is not clear whether “The Chef” is a real person or whether any more suspects are under investigation. Redzepagic pleaded not guilty during a court appearance on Thursday, and was released on a $500,000 bond. If convicted on all counts, he faces the possibility of decades in prison.

title: EUR/USD Dips: Critical Eurozone GDP and US CPI Data Loom, Threatening Market Calm
body: BitcoinWorld EUR/USD Dips: Critical Eurozone GDP and US CPI Data Loom, Threatening Market Calm LONDON, April 10, 2025 – The EUR/USD currency pair, the world’s most traded forex instrument, is drifting lower in early European trading. This cautious movement reflects a market holding its breath ahead of two pivotal economic releases: the Eurozone’s preliminary Gross Domestic Product (GDP) figures and the United States’ Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation report. Consequently, traders are positioning for potential volatility that could redefine monetary policy expectations for both the European Central Bank (ECB) and the Federal Reserve. EUR/USD Technical Drift Precedes Fundamental Storm The EUR/USD pair has retreated from recent highs, trading near 1.0820. This subtle decline is not driven by a single catalyst. Instead, it represents a classic pre-data consolidation. Market participants are reducing risk exposure before the dual data dump. Technical charts show the pair testing a key support zone between 1.0800 and 1.0825. A break below this level could trigger further selling pressure. Conversely, a positive data surprise for the Euro could spark a sharp reversal. Analysts note that trading volumes are below average, a typical sign of investor hesitation. “The market is in a state of suspended animation,” notes senior forex strategist, Clara Vance, referencing historical price action before major releases. “Positioning is light, and liquidity is thin, which often amplifies the eventual move once the data hits.” This environment makes the upcoming releases particularly consequential for short-term price direction. Eurozone GDP: A Litmus Test for Economic Resilience All eyes will first turn to the Eurozone’s preliminary Q1 GDP estimate. The bloc’s economy narrowly avoided a technical recession in late 2024. Therefore, this reading is crucial for assessing its current health. Economists’ consensus forecasts point to a modest quarterly growth of 0.2%. However, significant divergence exists among member states. National Disparities and ECB Policy Implications Germany, the largest economy, continues to show signs of manufacturing weakness. Meanwhile, southern economies like Spain and Italy have demonstrated unexpected resilience. This mixed picture complicates the ECB’s policy path. Stronger-than-expected GDP would bolster arguments for maintaining a restrictive monetary stance to combat lingering inflation. Conversely, a weak or negative print would increase pressure on the ECB to consider earlier rate cuts to stimulate growth. The following table outlines recent key Eurozone economic indicators: Indicator Last Release Trend Harmonised Index of Consumer Prices (HICP) 2.6% Declining, but above target Unemployment Rate 6.5% Historically low ZEW Economic Sentiment Index 15.2 Improving US CPI: The Federal Reserve’s North Star Hours after the Eurozone data, the US Bureau of Labor Statistics will release its March CPI report. This dataset serves as the primary inflation gauge for the Federal Reserve. Markets currently project a monthly increase of 0.3% for both headline and core CPI. The annual core CPI is expected to ease to 3.5%. Any deviation from these forecasts will directly impact the US Dollar’s strength. A hotter-than-expected print would reinforce the Fed’s patient stance on interest rate cuts. It could even revive talks of additional tightening. This scenario would likely propel the US Dollar higher, pressuring EUR/USD downward. Alternatively, a cooler inflation reading would fuel expectations for a mid-2025 rate cut. This could weaken the Dollar and provide lift for the Euro. Traders will scrutinize components like shelter and services inflation, which have proven sticky. Key factors influencing the US CPI reading include: Energy price fluctuations from the previous month. Persistent cost pressures in the services sector. Supply chain normalization for core goods. The Central Bank Policy Divergence Trade The ultimate driver for EUR/USD is the relative policy path between the ECB and the Fed. Throughout 2024, the theme was “divergence,” with the Fed expected to cut before the ECB. However, recent data has muddied this outlook. Today’s releases will provide critical evidence for this narrative. A strong Eurozone GDP coupled with a soft US CPI would narrow the policy gap, favoring Euro strength. The opposite combination would widen it, boosting the Dollar. Market Mechanics and Risk Sentiment Beyond direct policy implications, the data will influence global risk sentiment. Robust growth in both regions is positive for global markets. However, stagflationary signals—weak growth with high inflation—would be deeply negative. As a liquidity proxy, EUR/USD often moves inversely to broad market fear. A risk-off environment typically benefits the US Dollar as a safe-haven asset, weighing on the pair. Therefore, the collective interpretation of both data points will resonate across asset classes. Conclusion The current drift lower in the EUR/USD pair is a prelude to potential significant volatility. The simultaneous release of Eurozone GDP and US CPI data represents a fundamental inflection point. These reports will either confirm or challenge existing market assumptions about economic growth and inflation trajectories on both sides of the Atlantic. The resulting insights will directly shape expectations for the ECB and Federal Reserve, determining the next major trend for the world’s premier currency pair. Traders should prepare for elevated volatility and ensure risk management protocols are firmly in place. FAQs Q1: Why is the EUR/USD pair so important? The EUR/USD is the most liquid currency pair globally, representing the exchange rate between the world’s two largest economic blocs. It serves as a key benchmark for international trade, investment flows, and global risk sentiment. Q2: How does US CPI data affect the Euro? US CPI data influences the Federal Reserve’s interest rate policy. Higher inflation typically leads to a stronger US Dollar as rate cut expectations diminish. This Dollar strength usually causes EUR/USD to fall, as it takes fewer Dollars to buy one Euro. Q3: What would a strong Eurozone GDP number mean for the ECB? A strong GDP figure would indicate economic resilience, reducing immediate pressure on the European Central Bank to cut interest rates. It could allow the ECB to maintain a tighter policy for longer to ensure inflation returns fully to its 2% target. Q4: What is the market consensus for today’s data? Consensus forecasts suggest Eurozone Q1 GDP growth of 0.2% quarter-on-quarter and US monthly core CPI inflation of 0.3%. Significant deviations from these estimates are likely to trigger sharp currency movements. Q5: What other data points should traders watch alongside GDP and CPI? Traders will also monitor central bank speaker commentary, bond yield movements (especially the US 10-year Treasury and German Bund), and broader equity market performance for confirmation of the trends suggested by the hard data. This post EUR/USD Dips: Critical Eurozone GDP and US CPI Data Loom, Threatening Market Calm first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Gold Price Forecast: Tokenized Market Hits $6 Billion
body: Gold prices trade at $4,965 per ounce as of writing, up 2.4% over the past seven days, while the tokenized gold market has surged beyond $6 billion in total value. This rapid expansion marks one of the strongest growth phases in blockchain-based commodities, fueled largely by demand for gold-backed digital tokens. Industry data shows that tokenized commodities, led overwhelmingly by gold, have climbed 53% in under six weeks. The sector has added more than $2 billion year-to-date and now locks over 1.2 million ounces of physical gold in vaults that back digital tokens circulating on blockchain networks. Investors increasingly seek exposure to gold through on-chain instruments that offer 24/7 trading and fractional ownership. Source: @Gateresearch via X Gold Rally Drives On-Chain Demand The surge in tokenized gold closely tracks the metal’s historic price run. Gold rose from around $2,600 per ounce on January 2nd, 2025, to an all-time high of near $5,600 on January 28, 2026, according to Trading Economics data. Over the past two years, the metal has gained roughly 140%, supported by persistent inflation concerns, geopolitical tensions, central bank buying, and uncertainty around U.S. monetary and fiscal policy. As gold tested record levels, investors turned to blockchain-based versions of the asset. Tokenized gold allows holders to claim exposure to physical bullion stored in vaults without handling custody logistics. Settlement occurs on-chain with near-instant finality, which appeals to market participants who operate within digital asset ecosystems. XAUT and PAXG Command Market Share Two tokens dominate the space. Tether Gold (XAUT) and Paxos Gold (PAXG) together control approximately 96.7% of the tokenized gold market. XAUT’s market capitalization has climbed to $2.65 billion, reflecting gains of more than 50% over the past month. PAXG stands near $2.3 billion, supported by institutional interest in audited and compliant structures. Source: Our Crypto Talk via X This concentration underscores the rapid rise of real-world asset tokenization while highlighting structural questions. The dominance of two issuers concentrates counterparty and custody exposure within a narrow segment of the market. Any operational disruption or shift in trust toward these custodians could influence the broader $6 billion niche. The composable structure of decentralized finance adds another layer of complexity. Market participants often use tokenized gold as collateral across multiple protocols. Under stress conditions, liquidations within one platform could trigger broader market reactions. Such interconnections shape risk dynamics in ways that differ from traditional gold exchange-traded funds or direct physical holdings. A Split Market Narrative The growth of tokenized gold also reflects a broader shift in investor behavior. In an environment marked by ranging crypto prices and macroeconomic uncertainty, capital flows toward assets with perceived stability and tangible backing. At the same time, other segments of the digital asset market continue to attract speculative interest. This dual movement signals a market that searches for direction. Some investors hedge with blockchain-based gold, while others pursue high-risk opportunities elsewhere in crypto. Rather than contradict each other, these flows illustrate how participants adapt to changing economic signals. Last two weeks, Gold traded at historic levels and tokenized supply expands beyond 1.2 million ounces, and the digital commodities sector stands at a notable inflection point. The question now centers on whether sustained gold strength will continue to draw capital on-chain, or whether shifts in macro conditions will alter the pace of this rapid expansion.

title: Robinhood Makes Notable Confirmation about Ripple and XRP Ledger
body: Ripple has completed a significant milestone by tokenizing hundreds of millions of dollars in real-world assets (RWAs) on the XRP Ledger (XRPL). Robinhood confirmed this development in a recent report. The move positions XRP as a key platform for large-scale digital asset operations. Tokenization allows physical and financial assets to be represented digitally. By placing RWAs on the XRPL, Ripple enhances transparency, efficiency, and liquidity for investors. Robinhood has previously highlighted Ripple’s success in the tokenization space. This new confirmation signals increasing adoption of XRP for serious financial operations beyond traditional cryptocurrency trading. XRP Ledger Gains Institutional Recognition The XRPL has seen growing interest from institutional players. Ripple’s efforts highlight its potential to handle large-value transactions reliably. This is consistent with broader trends in which major financial firms explore tokenization for assets, such as real estate, money market funds, and treasuries. Steph Is Crypto (@Steph_iscrypto) emphasized the scale of Ripple’s achievement, noting that this move could open new avenues for investment and capital deployment. By integrating RWAs onto the XRPL, Ripple demonstrates the ledger’s capability to support complex financial structures without compromising speed or security. BREAKING: ROBINHOOD JUST CONFIRMED: RIPPLE HAS TOKENIZED HUNDREDS OF MILLIONS OF DOLLARS IN REAL-WORLD ASSETS ON THE $XRP LEDGER. pic.twitter.com/42A8aKCF5l — STEPH IS CRYPTO (@Steph_iscrypto) February 11, 2026 Ripple’s Role in Expanding Tokenized Markets Other firms have also entered the tokenization space. The image Steph shared revealed that Goldman Sachs has launched several projects focused on real estate and money market funds. Analysts, including McKinsey & Co., estimate that tokenized fund capitalization could reach $2 trillion by 2030, not counting other asset classes. Ripple’s activity, however, stands out because of its operational scale and the adoption of the XRPL. The network’s ability to manage large volumes of tokenized assets makes it a strategic option for financial institutions seeking efficiency in settlement and reporting. Potential for Increased Liquidity and Market Integration By tokenizing hundreds of millions of dollars in RWAs, Ripple opens the door to broader participation from institutional and retail investors. Tokenization on the XRPL can reduce transaction costs, accelerate settlement times, and create new liquidity channels for assets traditionally limited to select investors. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 This move also strengthens XRP’s position as a foundational digital asset . Its use in high-value tokenization projects demonstrates that the network can support both speculative trading and practical financial applications. What’s Next for Ripple and XRP? Robinhood’s report confirms that the XRPL is not only a medium for cryptocurrency transactions but also a viable platform for tokenized real-world assets. As Ripple grows its tokenized asset offerings, XRP’s relevance in the global financial system is expected to increase. Investors may view the ledger as a critical tool for bridging traditional finance and digital markets , signaling a new phase of adoption and innovation for the network. title: Coinbase CEO Armstrong Sells $550M Stock Over Past Year
body: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong sold approximately $550 million in company stock from early 2025 through January 2026. The sales were executed under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan adopted in August 2024.

title: Bitcoin ETFs bleed $410M as Standard Chartered slashes BTC target
body: US spot Bitcoin ETFs are on track for a fourth consecutive week of losses as Standard Chartered cut its 2026 Bitcoin target to $100,000.

title: Mirae Asset Consulting Secures Landmark 92% Stake in Korbit, Reshaping South Korea’s Crypto Future
body: BitcoinWorld Mirae Asset Consulting Secures Landmark 92% Stake in Korbit, Reshaping South Korea’s Crypto Future In a landmark move for South Korea’s digital finance sector, Mirae Asset Consulting has decisively become the largest shareholder in Korbit, one of the nation’s pioneering cryptocurrency exchanges. This seismic acquisition, finalized in Seoul on March 21, 2025, grants the non-financial affiliate of the Mirae Asset Group a commanding 92.06% stake. Consequently, this transaction fundamentally alters the ownership structure of a key player in Asia’s dynamic crypto market. Mirae Asset Consulting Becomes Largest Shareholder in Strategic Acquisition Mirae Asset Consulting executed a two-part acquisition to secure its dominant position. Initially, the firm acquired a 60.5% stake from NXC Corporation, the holding company famously known for its ownership of Nexon. Subsequently, it purchased an additional 31.6% stake from SK Planet, the digital commerce arm of the SK Group. The total deal value reached 133.48 billion Korean won, approximately $96.7 million. This strategic investment signals a major commitment from a traditional financial powerhouse to the digital asset ecosystem. Furthermore, this transaction represents one of the most significant ownership changes in the South Korean crypto industry since the implementation of stricter regulatory frameworks. The move provides Korbit with substantial institutional backing. Analysts immediately noted the potential for enhanced operational stability and capital reserves. The exchange can now leverage Mirae Asset’s extensive network and consulting expertise. Analyzing the South Korean Cryptocurrency Exchange Landscape To understand the impact, one must consider Korbit’s position within the domestic market. Founded in 2013, Korbit stands as one of South Korea’s ‘Big Four’ exchanges, alongside Upbit, Bithumb, and Coinone. The following table illustrates the shifting market dynamics post-acquisition: Exchange Primary Shareholder (Pre-2025) Key Strategic Move (2024-2025) Korbit NXC / SK Planet 92.06% acquired by Mirae Asset Consulting Upbit Dunamu Continued dominance, global expansion Bithumb Vidente / various Ongoing governance restructuring Coinone Coinone Holdings Focus on security and new blockchain services This consolidation under a major financial group’s umbrella is a pivotal trend. It reflects a maturation phase for the industry where compliance, deep pockets, and institutional trust become paramount. Regulators have actively encouraged stronger governance within crypto businesses. Therefore, Mirae Asset’s entry is viewed as a stabilizing force. Expert Analysis on Market Consolidation and Regulatory Alignment Financial analysts specializing in Asian fintech point to several key implications. First, the deal underscores the growing convergence between traditional finance (TradFi) and decentralized finance (DeFi) in regulated markets. Mirae Asset Group, with its vast portfolio in securities, asset management, and insurance, is strategically positioning itself. The group is clearly hedging against the future of digitized assets. Second, the acquisition provides Korbit with a critical advantage in navigating South Korea’s stringent regulatory environment. The Financial Services Commission (FSC) mandates strict anti-money laundering (AML) and know-your-customer (KYC) protocols. Mirae Asset’s established compliance frameworks can be seamlessly integrated. This integration potentially accelerates Korbit’s approval for new financial products. Third, from a competitive standpoint, this move pressures other exchanges to seek similar institutional partnerships. The era of founder-led crypto startups is giving way to an era of institutional stewardship. This shift aims to enhance consumer protection and market integrity. Data from the Korea Financial Intelligence Unit shows a direct correlation between institutional backing and reduced operational risk incidents. The Ripple Effects on Investors and the Broader Crypto Ecosystem The immediate effect has been a surge in positive sentiment among Korbit’s user base. Many investors associate Mirae Asset’s brand with security and longevity. Subsequently, market observers anticipate potential new offerings. These could include security token offerings (STOs), tokenized real-world assets (RWAs), and more sophisticated crypto-based financial derivatives. The parent group’s expertise in fund management could prove invaluable. Moreover, this development impacts the venture capital landscape. It signals to other traditional Korean conglomerates, or *chaebols*, that strategic investments in licensed crypto platforms are viable. This could unlock further capital inflow into the blockchain sector. However, experts caution that success hinges on seamless integration. The cultural and operational philosophies of a traditional consulting firm and a crypto-native exchange must align. Key potential impacts include: Enhanced Security Protocols: Expect significant investment in advanced cybersecurity measures and cold storage solutions. Product Diversification: Introduction of institutional-grade trading tools and custody services. Global Ambitions: Korbit may utilize Mirae Asset’s international network for strategic expansion into Southeast Asia. Regulatory Advocacy: A stronger, unified voice in policy discussions with Korean financial authorities. Conclusion The news that Mirae Asset Consulting becomes the largest shareholder in Korbit marks a definitive inflection point for South Korea’s cryptocurrency industry. This $96.7 million transaction transcends a simple change in ownership. It represents a powerful vote of confidence from traditional finance in the future of digital assets. Ultimately, this strategic move promises to enhance market stability, drive innovation, and strengthen consumer protection. The integration of Mirae Asset’s institutional rigor with Korbit’s technological agility will likely set a new benchmark for the entire sector. FAQs Q1: What percentage of Korbit does Mirae Asset Consulting now own? Mirae Asset Consulting now holds a 92.06% stake in Korbit, making it the undisputed largest shareholder. Q2: How much did Mirae Asset pay to become the largest shareholder in Korbit? The total acquisition price was 133.48 billion Korean won, which is approximately $96.7 million USD. Q3: Why is this acquisition significant for the South Korean crypto market? It signals deep institutional entry into the crypto space, potentially increasing market stability, improving regulatory compliance, and encouraging further traditional finance investments. Q4: Who did Mirae Asset buy the shares from? The shares were purchased from two previous major shareholders: a 60.5% stake from NXC (Nexon’s holding company) and a 31.6% stake from SK Planet. Q5: Will Korbit’s operations change immediately after this deal? While immediate drastic changes are unlikely, users can expect gradual enhancements in security, compliance, and potentially new, institutionally-focused financial products over the coming months. This post Mirae Asset Consulting Secures Landmark 92% Stake in Korbit, Reshaping South Korea’s Crypto Future first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Ethereum Weekly Transactions Shatter Records with 17.3 Million Milestone as Fees Plummet
body: BitcoinWorld Ethereum Weekly Transactions Shatter Records with 17.3 Million Milestone as Fees Plummet In a landmark development for blockchain technology, the Ethereum network has processed a staggering 17.3 million weekly transactions, setting a definitive new all-time high. This remarkable surge in network activity, reported by Cointelegraph via X and confirmed by data from analytics platform Token Terminal, coincides with a simultaneous and equally significant drop in median transaction fees to record lows. This dual achievement, observed globally in early 2025, signals a pivotal moment for the world’s leading smart contract platform, demonstrating both soaring demand and improved fundamental efficiency. Ethereum Weekly Transactions Reach Unprecedented Heights The new benchmark of 17.3 million Ethereum weekly transactions represents a substantial leap from previous peaks. This metric, which counts the total number of successful transactions validated on the blockchain within a seven-day period, is a core indicator of network utility and adoption. For context, this volume surpasses the activity seen during previous major bull markets and NFT minting frenzies. Consequently, analysts are scrutinizing the drivers behind this sustained activity spike. The data suggests a maturation of the ecosystem beyond speculative trading into robust, everyday use cases. Several key sectors are contributing to this transaction boom. Firstly, decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols continue to see significant user engagement for lending, borrowing, and yield generation. Secondly, the non-fungible token (NFT) ecosystem, including digital art, gaming assets, and tokenized real-world assets, maintains a steady flow of transactions. Furthermore, layer-2 scaling solutions, which batch transactions before settling them on Ethereum, are themselves generating substantial mainnet settlement activity. This multifaceted growth underscores Ethereum’s entrenched position as the foundational settlement layer for Web3. Record Low Fees Transform User Experience Perhaps more impactful than the high transaction count is the concurrent plunge in median gas fees. The “gas fee” is the price users pay to execute transactions or smart contracts on the Ethereum network. For years, high fees during periods of congestion were a major barrier to entry and a point of criticism. The current data shows these median fees have fallen to their lowest recorded levels, even as transaction volume hits its highest point. This counterintuitive trend is a direct result of successful network upgrades implemented over the past few years. The most significant upgrade, known as “The Merge,” transitioned Ethereum from a proof-of-work to a proof-of-stake consensus mechanism in 2022. This change laid the groundwork for improved efficiency. Subsequently, a series of upgrades, including proto-danksharding introduced in 2024, have dramatically increased the network’s data availability and processing capacity. The table below illustrates the stark contrast between network conditions during peak activity in previous years versus the current 2025 environment. Period Approx. Weekly Tx Volume Median Gas Fee (Gwei) Primary Driver May 2021 ~9.5 Million 150-200 DeFi Summer & NFT Boom Nov 2022 ~8.2 Million 20-40 Post-Merge Adjustment Early 2025 17.3 Million Scalability Upgrades & Broad Adoption This fee reduction has profound implications. It enables micro-transactions and makes interacting with decentralized applications (dApps) economically viable for a much broader global audience. Developers can now build more complex and user-friendly applications without fearing that high costs will deter users. Expert Analysis on Network Sustainability Blockchain infrastructure experts point to this data as evidence of a successful scalability roadmap. “The correlation of record-high throughput with record-low fees is the exact outcome the core development community has been working towards for nearly a decade,” notes a researcher from a major blockchain analytics firm. “It validates the multi-layered approach of enhancing the base layer while fostering a vibrant ecosystem of layer-2 rollups.” This environment reduces the risk of network congestion spirals, where high fees beget slower traffic, which historically hampered user experience. Moreover, the low-fee environment strengthens Ethereum’s value proposition against competing smart contract chains. While alternatives often marketed lower fees as a primary advantage, Ethereum’s combination of unparalleled security, decentralization, and now competitive cost structure presents a formidable package. The network effects of its massive developer community and trillion-dollar-plus ecosystem locked in DeFi protocols create a powerful moat that is becoming more accessible. The Road to Scalability: A Timeline of Key Upgrades Understanding the present milestone requires a look at the key technological upgrades that made it possible. Ethereum’s journey to scalability has been a deliberate, multi-phase process. The Merge (September 2022): This transition to proof-of-stake reduced Ethereum’s energy consumption by over 99% and set the stage for future scaling improvements by introducing a more modular architecture. The Surge (Ongoing): This phase focuses directly on scaling rollups and data storage. The pivotal EIP-4844 (proto-danksharding) upgrade, implemented in 2024, introduced “blobs” of data that dramatically reduced the cost for layer-2 networks to post data to Ethereum. Network Optimization (2023-2025): A series of smaller but crucial upgrades, like changes to gas costs for certain operations and client optimizations, have steadily improved network efficiency and client performance. Each step incrementally increased the network’s transactions per second (TPS) capacity and reduced costs. The current data from Token Terminal is the clearest real-world evidence that these technical efforts are translating into tangible user benefits. The ecosystem’s response has been immediate, with developers launching more data-intensive applications and projects migrating back to the Ethereum mainnet or its layer-2s due to the improved economic model. Broader Implications for the Cryptocurrency Ecosystem The record for Ethereum weekly transactions and low fees reverberates beyond its own blockchain. Firstly, it boosts the entire digital asset sector by demonstrating that core scalability challenges are being solved. Secondly, it enhances the viability of real-world asset tokenization, where high and unpredictable fees were a non-starter for institutional use cases. Financial institutions exploring blockchain settlement can now look at Ethereum with renewed seriousness due to its proven capacity and predictable costs. Furthermore, the health of the Ethereum network is a leading indicator for the broader decentralized application landscape. High activity with low fees suggests sustainable growth, not just speculative froth. This stability attracts more conservative capital and fosters innovation in sectors like: Decentralized physical infrastructure networks (DePIN) On-chain gaming and the metaverse Decentralized social media platforms Enterprise supply chain management solutions In essence, Ethereum is transitioning from a “crowded digital settlement layer” to a “high-throughput global utility.” This shift could accelerate the integration of blockchain technology into mainstream digital infrastructure. Conclusion The simultaneous achievement of record-breaking Ethereum weekly transactions and record-low median fees marks a historic inflection point for the network. It is the culmination of years of focused research, development, and community coordination. This milestone proves that the network can successfully scale to meet soaring demand while becoming more accessible and affordable for users worldwide. The data from Token Terminal is not just a statistic; it is a powerful signal of technological maturity and growing mainstream utility. As the network continues its upgrade path, these fundamentals of high throughput and low cost are likely to solidify Ethereum’s position as the foundational protocol for the next generation of the internet. FAQs Q1: What does “17.3 million weekly transactions” actually mean for Ethereum? A1: It means the Ethereum blockchain validated and recorded an average of over 2.4 million transactions per day, a definitive all-time high. This indicates massive and growing usage from decentralized apps, users, and institutions, reflecting strong network health and adoption. Q2: Why are gas fees so low even though transaction volume is so high? A2: Fees are low due to successful scalability upgrades, primarily EIP-4844 (proto-danksharding). This upgrade significantly increased the network’s data availability capacity, reducing competition for block space. It allows more transactions to be processed at a lower cost per transaction. Q3: How does this transaction volume compare to traditional payment networks like Visa? A3: While 17.3 million weekly transactions (approx. 110 TPS) is a record for Ethereum, it is still far below centralized networks like Visa, which can handle thousands of TPS. However, Ethereum transactions are globally settled, immutable, and often involve complex smart contract logic, making direct comparisons difficult. The key trend is Ethereum’s rapid scaling progress. Q4: Will fees stay low permanently now? A4: While the network’s base capacity is now much higher, fees are still subject to supply and demand. Periods of extreme, sudden demand could cause temporary fee spikes. However, the long-term trend is toward lower and more stable fees due to continued scaling work and the proliferation of layer-2 solutions that handle activity off the main chain. Q5: What is the main takeaway for investors and developers from this news? A5: For developers, it confirms that building on Ethereum is more viable than ever, with a huge user base and affordable operations. For investors, it demonstrates the network’s ability to execute its roadmap, solve critical problems, and grow utility—key fundamentals for long-term value accrual in the ecosystem. This post Ethereum Weekly Transactions Shatter Records with 17.3 Million Milestone as Fees Plummet first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Bitcoin Capital Inflow Metric Plunges: First Negative Reading in 3 Years Signals Critical Market Shift
body: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Capital Inflow Metric Plunges: First Negative Reading in 3 Years Signals Critical Market Shift In a significant development for cryptocurrency markets, the Bitcoin Long-Term Holder Realized Cap Impulse has turned negative for the first time since 2022, according to analytics firm Alphractal. This crucial capital inflow metric, which measures actual money entering the Bitcoin network, signals a potential structural shift in market dynamics that could influence the current cycle’s trajectory. The negative reading emerges as Bitcoin consolidates following its 2024 halving event, raising important questions about demand sustainability and capital rotation patterns. Understanding the Bitcoin Capital Inflow Metric The Long-Term Holder Realized Cap Impulse represents a sophisticated analytical tool that tracks capital movements within the Bitcoin ecosystem. Unlike simple price metrics, this indicator measures changes in realized capitalization by reflecting the price at which each BTC last moved on-chain. Essentially, it shows actual capital inflows over time by tracking when coins change hands and at what valuation. When long-term holders sell coins they acquired at lower prices, the realized cap increases, signaling new capital entering the network. Conversely, when these holders reduce activity or sell coins purchased at higher prices, the metric can turn negative. Analysts consider this metric particularly valuable because it filters out speculative noise and focuses on substantive capital movements. The realized cap methodology, originally developed by David Puell and Rafael Schultze-Kraft, provides a more accurate picture of the actual economic value stored in Bitcoin. By focusing specifically on long-term holders (entities holding coins for 155 days or more), the impulse metric captures behavior from the most committed market participants. These holders typically demonstrate stronger conviction and different behavioral patterns compared to short-term traders. How the Metric Calculates Capital Flow The calculation involves several precise steps. First, analysts determine the realized price for each Bitcoin transaction based on when the coin last moved. Next, they aggregate these values to calculate the total realized capitalization. The impulse component then measures the rate of change in this realized cap over specific periods. A positive impulse indicates accelerating capital inflows, while a negative impulse suggests deceleration or outflow. The current negative reading specifically reflects decreased capital commitment from long-term holders, who typically provide market stability during volatile periods. Historical Context and Market Implications Historical data reveals that previous negative readings of this metric have coincided with important market transitions. The last sustained negative period occurred between late 2021 and early 2022, preceding the significant market correction that followed Bitcoin’s all-time high. Before that, similar patterns emerged in 2018 following the previous cycle’s peak. These historical parallels suggest that the current negative reading may indicate a transition from the accumulation phase to a distribution or consolidation phase in the current market cycle. Market analysts note several potential implications of this development. First, reduced capital inflow from long-term holders could signal profit-taking behavior following Bitcoin’s substantial appreciation since 2023. Second, it may indicate capital rotation into other cryptocurrency assets or traditional financial instruments. Third, the negative reading could reflect macroeconomic factors influencing investor behavior, including interest rate expectations and regulatory developments. Importantly, a single negative reading doesn’t necessarily predict immediate price declines, but rather suggests changing underlying dynamics that could influence future price action. Historical Bitcoin Capital Inflow Metric Readings Period Metric Reading Market Context Q4 2021 – Q1 2022 Negative Post-ATH correction phase Q2 2020 – Q1 2021 Positive Bull market acceleration 2018-2019 Negative Bear market consolidation Current (2025) Negative Post-halving evaluation Expert Analysis and Market Perspectives Alphractal’s research team emphasizes that the negative turn represents more than just a statistical anomaly. According to their analysis, this development marks “the beginning of a phase of structurally weakening capital inflow for the current cycle.” This assessment aligns with observations from other analytics firms tracking on-chain metrics. Glassnode’s weekly reports have noted similar patterns in other long-term holder metrics, while CryptoQuant data shows changing exchange flow patterns that complement these findings. Several factors may be contributing to this structural shift. Institutional adoption patterns have evolved significantly since 2022, with different capital deployment strategies emerging. The maturation of Bitcoin financial products, including ETFs and derivatives, has created new pathways for capital allocation. Additionally, macroeconomic conditions in 2025 present different challenges and opportunities compared to previous cycles. Higher interest rate environments, evolving regulatory frameworks, and geopolitical considerations all influence capital allocation decisions among long-term holders. Comparative Analysis with Other Market Indicators To properly contextualize this development, analysts typically examine multiple complementary indicators. The MVRV (Market Value to Realized Value) ratio, which compares Bitcoin’s market capitalization to its realized capitalization, provides additional perspective on whether current prices reflect underlying value. Network activity metrics, including active addresses and transaction volumes, offer insights into user adoption trends. Exchange net flows help determine whether coins are moving to or from trading platforms, indicating potential selling pressure or accumulation behavior. Current data shows interesting divergences between different indicator categories. While the long-term holder impulse has turned negative, some short-term metrics show continued resilience. This divergence suggests a complex market environment where different participant groups exhibit contrasting behaviors. Retail activity patterns, institutional flows, and miner behavior each tell different parts of the story. The challenge for analysts lies in synthesizing these signals into a coherent market narrative that accounts for multiple timeframes and participant types. MVRV Ratio: Currently at 2.1, suggesting moderate overvaluation relative to realized value Exchange Net Flow: Slightly negative, indicating net withdrawal from exchanges Active Addresses: Stable at approximately 900,000 daily Hash Rate: Continuing its upward trajectory, reaching new all-time highs Potential Scenarios and Market Outcomes Based on historical patterns and current conditions, several scenarios could unfold following this negative reading. In an optimistic scenario, the negative impulse represents temporary profit-taking before renewed accumulation, similar to patterns observed in 2016. A neutral scenario suggests extended consolidation within a defined range while capital reallocates across different asset classes. A more cautious scenario involves continued capital outflow leading to a more significant correction, particularly if macroeconomic conditions deteriorate further. Each scenario carries different implications for various market participants. Long-term investors might view potential weakness as accumulation opportunities, while traders could adjust strategies based on changing volatility expectations. Institutions implementing Bitcoin allocation strategies may reconsider timing and sizing decisions. Miners facing the post-halving environment must balance operational considerations with potential price impacts. The diversity of perspectives and strategies ensures continued market activity regardless of directional bias. Broader Cryptocurrency Market Context The Bitcoin capital inflow development occurs within a broader cryptocurrency ecosystem experiencing its own transformations. Ethereum’s transition to proof-of-stake continues to influence capital allocation decisions. Layer 2 solutions and alternative Layer 1 networks have captured significant market attention and investment. Decentralized finance protocols, non-fungible token markets, and emerging Web3 applications all compete for capital within the digital asset space. This competitive landscape means that Bitcoin’s capital flow metrics must be understood in relative rather than absolute terms. Regulatory developments in major jurisdictions also influence capital allocation decisions. Clearer frameworks in some regions have encouraged institutional participation, while uncertainty in others has created headwinds. Taxation policies, custody solutions, and banking relationships all affect how capital enters and exits cryptocurrency markets. The maturation of market infrastructure, including improved custody options and trading venues, has changed the mechanics of capital movement compared to previous cycles. Methodological Considerations and Data Quality When interpreting capital inflow metrics, several methodological considerations deserve attention. On-chain analytics rely on transparent blockchain data, but interpretation requires careful analysis. The definition of “long-term holder” (typically 155+ days) represents one possible threshold among many. Different analytics platforms may use slightly different methodologies or update frequencies. Additionally, the growing use of privacy-enhancing techniques and off-chain transactions creates measurement challenges that analysts must acknowledge. Data quality has improved significantly since earlier market cycles, with multiple reputable analytics firms providing consistent metrics. Cross-referencing between different data sources helps validate findings and identify potential anomalies. The professionalization of cryptocurrency analytics has led to more sophisticated tools and better educational resources for interpreting complex metrics. This maturation benefits all market participants seeking to make informed decisions based on substantive data rather than speculation. Conclusion The negative turn in Bitcoin’s Long-Term Holder Realized Cap Impulse represents a significant development worthy of careful attention from market participants. This Bitcoin capital inflow metric, turning negative for the first time in three years, signals potential structural changes in how capital enters and sustains the network. While historical patterns provide useful context, each market cycle presents unique characteristics influenced by evolving adoption patterns, regulatory frameworks, and macroeconomic conditions. Market participants should monitor this and complementary indicators while maintaining perspective on longer-term adoption trends and technological fundamentals. The current reading emphasizes the importance of sophisticated analytics in understanding complex cryptocurrency market dynamics beyond simple price movements. FAQs Q1: What does the Bitcoin Long-Term Holder Realized Cap Impulse measure? This metric tracks changes in the realized capitalization specifically for coins held by long-term holders (155+ days). It shows whether capital is flowing into or out of this segment by measuring the price at which their coins last moved on-chain. Q2: How often has this metric turned negative historically? Significant negative periods occurred in 2018-2019 and late 2021-early 2022. The current negative reading in 2025 marks the first such occurrence in three years, making it notable for market analysts. Q3: Does a negative reading automatically mean Bitcoin’s price will decline? Not necessarily. While negative readings have coincided with corrections historically, they indicate changing capital flow dynamics rather than directly predicting price direction. Other factors including macroeconomic conditions and adoption trends also influence price. Q4: How do analysts distinguish between normal profit-taking and structural capital outflow? Analysts examine the magnitude, duration, and context of the negative reading. They also review complementary metrics including exchange flows, derivative market positioning, and macroeconomic indicators to develop a comprehensive view. Q5: What should investors consider when interpreting this development? Investors should consider their time horizon, risk tolerance, and portfolio strategy. Long-term investors might view potential weakness as accumulation opportunities, while traders may adjust short-term strategies. Consulting multiple data sources and maintaining diversification remains prudent. This post Bitcoin Capital Inflow Metric Plunges: First Negative Reading in 3 Years Signals Critical Market Shift first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Börse Stuttgart Crypto Merger: Germany’s Bold €500M Power Play Reshapes European Digital Finance
body: BitcoinWorld Börse Stuttgart Crypto Merger: Germany’s Bold €500M Power Play Reshapes European Digital Finance FRANKFURT, GERMANY – December 2024 – Europe’s financial landscape undergoes a significant transformation as Börse Stuttgart Group announces its strategic merger with digital asset specialist Tradias. This €500 million enterprise value combination represents Germany’s most substantial move yet to establish regulatory-compliant cryptocurrency infrastructure within traditional finance frameworks. The Börse Stuttgart crypto merger signals a pivotal moment for institutional adoption across continental markets. Börse Stuttgart Crypto Merger Creates European Digital Asset Leader Bloomberg reports confirm Börse Stuttgart Group, Europe’s sixth-largest exchange operator, will merge its cryptocurrency operations with Frankfurt-based Tradias. The combined entity boasts an enterprise valuation exceeding €500 million ($540 million), with Tradias alone valued at approximately €200 million ($216 million). This consolidation creates Germany’s largest regulated digital asset platform with approximately 300 employees. A joint management team from both organizations will oversee operations, blending traditional exchange expertise with crypto-native innovation. This strategic move follows Börse Stuttgart’s gradual expansion into digital assets since 2019. The exchange launched its BISON trading app and BSDEX trading venue, establishing early footholds in retail and institutional crypto markets. Meanwhile, Tradias emerged as a critical wholesale liquidity provider for German banks entering cryptocurrency services. The merger effectively verticalizes Germany’s digital asset ecosystem under one corporate structure. European Exchange Consolidation Accelerates Germany’s financial sector demonstrates increasing institutional confidence in cryptocurrency infrastructure. The Bundesbank and BaFin have developed Europe’s most comprehensive regulatory frameworks for digital assets. Consequently, traditional financial institutions now seek compliant entry points into cryptocurrency markets. The Börse Stuttgart-Tradias combination directly addresses this institutional demand through regulated trading, custody, and settlement services. European exchange consolidation reflects broader market maturation. Deutsche Börse previously invested in Crypto Finance AG, while Switzerland’s SIX Group operates its digital exchange SDX. However, the Börse Stuttgart crypto merger represents the first full integration of traditional exchange operations with crypto-native trading technology at this scale. Market analysts anticipate similar consolidations across France, Netherlands, and Nordic markets throughout 2025. Regulatory Compliance as Competitive Advantage Germany’s crypto custody license (Kryptoverwahrlizenz) under the German Banking Act creates significant barriers to entry. Both Börse Stuttgart and Tradias hold these licenses, giving the merged entity regulatory advantages over international competitors. The combined platform will offer MiFID-compliant trading, institutional-grade custody, and blockchain settlement services. This regulatory positioning aligns with Europe’s Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) regulations taking full effect in 2025. The merger’s timing coincides with increasing institutional cryptocurrency allocation. European pension funds, insurance companies, and asset managers now allocate approximately 2-3% of portfolios to digital assets according to recent ECB research. Traditional exchanges must provide compliant infrastructure to capture this growing institutional demand. The Börse Stuttgart crypto merger positions Germany as Europe’s primary gateway for regulated digital asset access. Market Impact and Competitive Landscape The combined entity immediately becomes Europe’s largest regulated crypto exchange by enterprise value. Traditional competitors include Deutsche Börse’s Crypto Finance subsidiary and Switzerland’s SDX, while crypto-native platforms like Kraken and Coinbase maintain significant European market share. However, the merged platform’s unique positioning bridges traditional finance and cryptocurrency ecosystems through: Regulatory compliance: Full BaFin licensing for trading and custody Institutional access: Direct connectivity to existing exchange infrastructure Liquidity aggregation: Combining retail and institutional order books Technology integration: Traditional settlement systems with blockchain execution Market structure analysis reveals Germany’s strategic importance in European finance. Frankfurt hosts the European Central Bank and Germany’s federal financial regulator. The city’s established financial infrastructure provides natural advantages for digital asset innovation. The Börse Stuttgart crypto merger leverages this geographic and regulatory positioning to capture first-mover advantages in institutional crypto services. Employment and Economic Implications The approximately 300 employees across both organizations represent Europe’s largest concentration of regulated digital asset professionals. This talent pool combines traditional finance expertise with blockchain technology specialization. Germany’s financial technology sector continues expanding despite broader economic challenges, with fintech employment growing 15% annually according to Bundesbank statistics. The merger creates Europe’s most comprehensive digital asset career pathway. Employees gain exposure to traditional exchange operations, cryptocurrency trading technology, regulatory compliance, and blockchain development. This human capital development supports Germany’s strategic objective to lead European financial technology innovation through the Digital Finance Strategy 2025 initiative. Technological Integration Challenges and Opportunities Combining traditional exchange infrastructure with cryptocurrency technology presents significant technical challenges. Börse Stuttgart operates T7, its high-performance trading system serving European equity and derivatives markets. Integrating this with Tradias’s digital asset trading platform requires careful architectural planning. However, successful integration creates Europe’s first truly hybrid trading infrastructure supporting both traditional and digital assets. The technological roadmap likely includes: Integration Phase Technical Focus Timeline Phase 1 Shared liquidity pools Q1 2025 Phase 2 Unified trading interface Q2 2025 Phase 3 Cross-asset settlement Q4 2025 Blockchain technology integration represents another critical opportunity. The merged entity can leverage distributed ledger technology for settlement efficiency, asset tokenization, and regulatory reporting. Germany’s eWpG (Electronic Securities Act) already enables blockchain-based securities, creating immediate use cases for the combined platform’s technology stack. Conclusion The Börse Stuttgart crypto merger with Tradias represents a watershed moment for European digital finance. This €500 million combination creates Germany’s dominant regulated digital asset platform just as MiCA regulations take effect. The merger accelerates institutional cryptocurrency adoption through compliant infrastructure while positioning Frankfurt as Europe’s digital asset hub. As traditional finance increasingly embraces blockchain technology, the Börse Stuttgart crypto merger provides a blueprint for regulated innovation that balances market efficiency with investor protection. FAQs Q1: What is the enterprise value of the merged Börse Stuttgart and Tradias entity? The combined enterprise value exceeds €500 million ($540 million), with Tradias valued at approximately €200 million ($216 million) before the merger. Q2: How does this merger affect Germany’s position in European cryptocurrency markets? The merger establishes Germany as Europe’s leading regulated digital asset jurisdiction, leveraging comprehensive BaFin licensing and Frankfurt’s existing financial infrastructure. Q3: What regulatory advantages does the merged entity possess? Both companies hold Germany’s crypto custody licenses under the German Banking Act, providing MiFID-compliant trading and custody services ahead of Europe’s MiCA regulations. Q4: How many employees will work for the combined company? The merged entity will employ approximately 300 professionals, creating Europe’s largest concentration of regulated digital asset expertise. Q5: What traditional financial services will integrate with cryptocurrency trading? The merger enables integration between Börse Stuttgart’s T7 trading system and digital asset platforms, potentially creating Europe’s first hybrid trading infrastructure for both traditional and crypto assets. This post Börse Stuttgart Crypto Merger: Germany’s Bold €500M Power Play Reshapes European Digital Finance first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Strategy’s STRC tops $100 following two-week lull
body: Strategy saw a silver lining after the latest market downturn. The STRC preferred stock returned above $100, allowing more selling and potential BTC purchases. After two weeks of dormancy, Strategy’s STRC returned to above $100 valuations. At this price range, Strategy can sell more preferred shares, boosting its ability to not skip weekly BTC purchases. STRC is one of the solutions for tapping the MSTR common stock facility, which has led to fast dilution. However, Strategy tries to sell STRC in a tight range, with new additions only when the price rises above $100. In this price range, selling STRC slightly decreases its value, while leaving Strategy with extra funds for BTC purchases. The STRC preferred stock still has to pay out 11.25% in mandatory monthly dividends, which puts a dent into Strategy’s cash pile. For now, Strategy has set up reserves to serve its obligations and debt while waiting for a better time for BTC. STRC rises to $100.03 On Thursday, STRC rose above $100, entering the range between $99 and $101, at which Strategy may extend selling. In the past week, Strategy achieved $13M in STRC volume above $100 on Wednesday, and another $193M on Thursday. This amount was enough to buy 49% of the BTC mined in the past week. STRC returned above $100, allowing Strategy more access to capital, while buyers receive an 11.25% dividend paid out monthly. | Source: BitcoinQuant . In total, STRC sales may allow for the purchase of 1,557 BTC. For now, this amount is relatively small and does not affect the market, which sees even bigger selling pressure. Despite this, STRC is heavily advertised , and some investors may switch to the preferred dividend stock at a time of higher market volatility. STRC supporters claim the undervalued BTC is a call to switch to the preferred stock. For some, the dividend is used to buy the dip on BTC, while retaining their initial value. In this way, the cash reserves of Strategy are also redirected into BTC, while awaiting a recovery. Is STRC viable? Supporters may use STRC for compounding or waiting out for a bull market in BTC . The success of Strategy’s preferred stock still depends on a BTC bull market. In the long term, Strategy expects BTC performance to offset the dividends paid for STRC. However, Strategy will still require cash, and for now, no cash has been raised from BTC sales. Strategy has claimed its playbook can survive as long as BTC stays above $8,000, by securing accessible capital through STRC and, more recently, the Euro-denominated SATA. In February, MSTR common stock held above $123. Hypothetically, the common stock may appreciate in a positive BTC scenario, allowing Strategy to raise additional funds. For now, there are still fears that a protracted bear market can break Strategy’s playbook. Get 8% CASHBACK when you spend crypto with COCA Visa card. Order your FREE card.
